Submodules¶

seeFretboard.Utilities.Constants module¶

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions module¶

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.calculateHalfSteps(startNote, endNote)[source]¶

Calculates the number of half steps between two notes, considering enharmonic equivalents.

Parameters:

  • startNote (str) – The starting note.

  • endNote (str) – The ending note.

Returns:

The number of half steps from startNote to endNote. Returns 0 if startNote and endNote are the same.

Return type:

int

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.checkChordType(type, seve=False)[source]¶

Checks if the provided chord type is valid.

Parameters:

  • type (str) – The chord type to check.

  • seve (bool) – If True, check for valid chord types for seventh chords.

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided chord type is not valid.

class seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.customShapes[source]¶

Bases: object

A class representing a collection of custom shapes.

Custom shapes can be added to the collection and retrieved based on their shape name.

customShapes¶

A dictionary containing custom guitar shapes. The dictionary structure should be as follows: {

shapeName1: {

note: [list of notes], position: [list of positions], scaleDegree: [list of scale degrees]

}, shapeName2: {

note: [list of notes], position: [list of positions], scaleDegree: [list of scale degrees]

}

Type:

dict

addShape(shapeName, notes, positions, scaleDegrees)[source]¶

Add a custom guitar shape to the customShapes dictionary.

Parameters:

  • shape_name (str) – The name of the custom shape.

  • notes (list) – A list of notes for the custom shape.

  • positions (list) – A list of positions for the custom shape.

  • scale_degrees (list) – A list of scale degrees for the custom shape.

Returns:

None

getShape(shapeName)[source]¶

Retrieve a custom guitar shape from the customShapes dictionary.

Parameters:

shape_name (str) – The name of the custom shape.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the custom shape, containing the following keys:

  • ’note’: List of notes

  • ’position’: List of positions

  • ’scaleDegree’: List of scale degrees

Return type:

dict

removeShape(shapeName)[source]¶

Remove a custom guitar shape from the customShapes dictionary.

Parameters:

shape_name (str) – The name of the custom shape.

Returns:

True if the shape was successfully removed, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.fretToMidi(string, fret)[source]¶

Converts a fret number on a string to a MIDI note number.

Parameters:

  • string (int) – The string number, where 1 is the highest pitch string.

  • fret (int) – The fret number on the string.

Returns:

The MIDI note number corresponding to the fret on the string.

Return type:

midi (int)

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.fretsToMidi(string, frets)[source]¶

Converts a list of frets on a string to MIDI note numbers.

Parameters:

  • string (int) – The string number, where 1 is the highest pitch string.

  • frets (list) – The list of fret numbers on the string.

Returns:

The list of MIDI note numbers corresponding to the frets.

Return type:

midiNotes (list)

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.getNoteFromInterval(note, interval, rootNote)[source]¶

Returns a new note that is the given interval away from the input note.

Parameters:

  • note (str) – The starting note.

  • interval (int) – The interval (number) indicating the distance from the starting note.

Returns:

The new note that is interval away from the input note. Will be in # unless it is the root note

Return type:

str

  • dictionary (dict) – The dictionary to check.

Raises:

ValueError – If the value is not present in the dictionary.

Converts an interval name to a scale degree.

Parameters:

interval (str) – The interval name (e.g. “M3”, “P5”)

Returns:

The scale degree (e.g. “3”, “5”) corresponding to the interval.

Return type:

degree (str)

Returns:

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.midiToFret(string, midiNotes)[source]¶

Converts a MIDI note number to a fret number for a given string.

Parameters:

  • string (int) – The string number, where 1 is the highest pitch string.

  • midiNotes (list) – The list of MIDI note numbers for each string, from lowest to highest pitch.

Returns:

The fret number corresponding to the MIDI note on the given string.

Return type:

fret (int)

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.midiToNoteNameWithOctave(midiNote)[source]¶

Converts a MIDI note number to a note name with octave.

Parameters:

midiNote (int) – The MIDI note number.

Returns:

The note name and octave (e.g. “C4”, “F#5”) corresponding to the MIDI note number.

Return type:

noteNameWithOctave (str)

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.processCAGEDShape(caged, rootNote, type='major')[source]¶

Process a CAGED shape for a given root note and type.

Parameters:

  • caged (str) – The CAGED shape to process (‘c’, ‘a’, ‘g’, ‘d’, etc.).

  • rootNote (str) – The root note.

  • type (str, optional) – The type of chord or scale. Defaults to ‘major’.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If an invalid CAGED shape is provided.

  • ValueError – If the given type does not exist in the shape.

Returns:

The processed CAGED shape information.

Return type:

dict

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.processDropShape(drop, rootNote, type, string, shapePos)[source]¶

Processes a drop shape by calculating the corresponding notes, positions, and scale degrees.

Parameters:

  • drop (str) – The drop shape name.

  • rootNote (str) – The root note of the shape.

  • type (str) – The type of the chord: maj7, dom7, min7, min7b5, dim7

  • string (str) – The string of the shape.

  • shapePos (str) – The position of the shape.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the processed shape information. It has the following structure: {

”note”: {

type: [list of notes]

}, “position”: {

type: [list of positions]

}, “scaleDegree”: {

type: [list of scale degrees]

}

}

Return type:

processedShape (dict)

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.scaleDegreeToInterval(degree)[source]¶

Converts a scale degree to an interval name.

Parameters:

degree (str) – The scale degree (e.g. “3”, “5”)

Returns:

The interval name (e.g. “M3”, “P5”) corresponding to the scale degree.

Return type:

interval (str)

seeFretboard.Utilities.Functions.scaleDegreesToIntervals(degrees)[source]¶

Converts a list of scale degrees to intervals.

Parameters:

degrees (list) – A list of scale degree numbers (e.g. “3”, “5”)

Returns:

The list of interval names (e.g. “M3”, “P5”) corresponding to the scale degrees.

Return type:

intervals (list)
